00005 """Handle version information related to Visual Stuio."""

00016 class VisualStudioVersion(object):
00017   """Information regarding a version of Visual Studio."""
00018 
00019   def __init__(self, short_name, description,
00020                solution_version, project_version, flat_sln, uses_vcxproj,
00021                path, sdk_based, default_toolset=None):
00022     self.short_name = short_name
00023     self.description = description
00024     self.solution_version = solution_version
00025     self.project_version = project_version
00026     self.flat_sln = flat_sln
00027     self.uses_vcxproj = uses_vcxproj
00028     self.path = path
00029     self.sdk_based = sdk_based
00030     self.default_toolset = default_toolset
00031 
00032   def ShortName(self):
00033     return self.short_name
00034 
00035   def Description(self):
00036     """Get the full description of the version."""
00037     return self.description
00038 
00039   def SolutionVersion(self):
00040     """Get the version number of the sln files."""
00041     return self.solution_version
00042 
00043   def ProjectVersion(self):
00044     """Get the version number of the vcproj or vcxproj files."""
00045     return self.project_version
00046 
00047   def FlatSolution(self):
00048     return self.flat_sln
00049 
00050   def UsesVcxproj(self):
00051     """Returns true if this version uses a vcxproj file."""
00052     return self.uses_vcxproj
00053 
00054   def ProjectExtension(self):
00055     """Returns the file extension for the project."""
00056     return self.uses_vcxproj and '.vcxproj' or '.vcproj'
00057 
00058   def Path(self):
00059     """Returns the path to Visual Studio installation."""
00060     return self.path
00061 
00062   def ToolPath(self, tool):
00063     """Returns the path to a given compiler tool. """
00064     return os.path.normpath(os.path.join(self.path, "VC/bin", tool))
00065 
00066   def DefaultToolset(self):
00067     """Returns the msbuild toolset version that will be used in the absence
00068     of a user override."""
00069     return self.default_toolset
00070 
00071   def SetupScript(self, target_arch):
00072     """Returns a command (with arguments) to be used to set up the
00073     environment."""
00074     # Check if we are running in the SDK command line environment and use
00075     # the setup script from the SDK if so. |target_arch| should be either
00076     # 'x86' or 'x64'.
00077     assert target_arch in ('x86', 'x64')
00078     sdk_dir = os.environ.get('WindowsSDKDir')
00079     if self.sdk_based and sdk_dir:
00080       return [os.path.normpath(os.path.join(sdk_dir, 'Bin/SetEnv.Cmd')),
00081               '/' + target_arch]
00082     else:
00083       # We don't use VC/vcvarsall.bat for x86 because vcvarsall calls
00084       # vcvars32, which it can only find if VS??COMNTOOLS is set, which it
00085       # isn't always.
00086       if target_arch == 'x86':
00087         if self.short_name == '2013' and (
00088             os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE') == 'AMD64' or
00089             os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITEW6432') == 'AMD64'):
00090           # VS2013 non-Express has a x64-x86 cross that we want to prefer.
00091           return [os.path.normpath(
00092              os.path.join(self.path, 'VC/vcvarsall.bat')), 'amd64_x86']
00093         # Otherwise, the standard x86 compiler.
00094         return [os.path.normpath(
00095           os.path.join(self.path, 'Common7/Tools/vsvars32.bat'))]
00096       else:
00097         assert target_arch == 'x64'
00098         arg = 'x86_amd64'
00099         # Use the 64-on-64 compiler if we're not using an express
00100         # edition and we're running on a 64bit OS.
00101         if self.short_name[-1] != 'e' and (
00102             os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE') == 'AMD64' or
00103             os.environ.get('PROCESSOR_ARCHITEW6432') == 'AMD64'):
00104           arg = 'amd64'
00105         return [os.path.normpath(
00106             os.path.join(self.path, 'VC/vcvarsall.bat')), arg]
00107 
00108 
00109 def _RegistryQueryBase(sysdir, key, value):
00110   """Use reg.exe to read a particular key.
00111 
00112   While ideally we might use the win32 module, we would like gyp to be
00113   python neutral, so for instance cygwin python lacks this module.
00114 
00115   Arguments:
00116     sysdir: The system subdirectory to attempt to launch reg.exe from.
00117     key: The registry key to read from.
00118     value: The particular value to read.
00119   Return:
00120     stdout from reg.exe, or None for failure.
00121   """
00122   # Skip if not on Windows or Python Win32 setup issue
00123   if sys.platform not in ('win32', 'cygwin'):
00124     return None
00125   # Setup params to pass to and attempt to launch reg.exe
00126   cmd = [os.path.join(os.environ.get('WINDIR', ''), sysdir, 'reg.exe'),
00127          'query', key]
00128   if value:
00129     cmd.extend(['/v', value])
00130   p = subprocess.Popen(cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE)
00131   # Obtain the stdout from reg.exe, reading to the end so p.returncode is valid
00132   # Note that the error text may be in [1] in some cases
00133   text = p.communicate()[0]
00134   # Check return code from reg.exe; officially 0==success and 1==error
00135   if p.returncode:
00136     return None
00137   return text
00138 
00139 
00140 def _RegistryQuery(key, value=None):
00141   r"""Use reg.exe to read a particular key through _RegistryQueryBase.
00142 
00143   First tries to launch from %WinDir%\Sysnative to avoid WoW64 redirection. If
00144   that fails, it falls back to System32.  Sysnative is available on Vista and
00145   up and available on Windows Server 2003 and XP through KB patch 942589. Note
00146   that Sysnative will always fail if using 64-bit python due to it being a
00147   virtual directory and System32 will work correctly in the first place.
00148 
00149   KB 942589 - http://support.microsoft.com/kb/942589/en-us.
00150 
00151   Arguments:
00152     key: The registry key.
00153     value: The particular registry value to read (optional).
00154   Return:
00155     stdout from reg.exe, or None for failure.
00156   """
00157   text = None
00158   try:
00159     text = _RegistryQueryBase('Sysnative', key, value)
00160   except OSError, e:
00161     if e.errno == errno.ENOENT:
00162       text = _RegistryQueryBase('System32', key, value)
00163     else:
00164       raise
00165   return text
00166 
00167 
00168 def _RegistryGetValueUsingWinReg(key, value):
00169   """Use the _winreg module to obtain the value of a registry key.
00170 
00171   Args:
00172     key: The registry key.
00173     value: The particular registry value to read.
00174   Return:
00175     contents of the registry key's value, or None on failure.  Throws
00176     ImportError if _winreg is unavailable.
00177   """
00178   import _winreg
00179   try:
00180     root, subkey = key.split('\\', 1)
00181     assert root == 'HKLM'  # Only need HKLM for now.
00182     with _winreg.OpenKey(_winreg.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE, subkey) as hkey:
00183       return _winreg.QueryValueEx(hkey, value)[0]
00184   except WindowsError:
00185     return None
00186 
00187 
00188 def _RegistryGetValue(key, value):
00189   """Use _winreg or reg.exe to obtain the value of a registry key.
00190 
00191   Using _winreg is preferable because it solves an issue on some corporate
00192   environments where access to reg.exe is locked down. However, we still need
00193   to fallback to reg.exe for the case where the _winreg module is not available
00194   (for example in cygwin python).
00195 
00196   Args:
00197     key: The registry key.
00198     value: The particular registry value to read.
00199   Return:
00200     contents of the registry key's value, or None on failure.
00201   """
00202   try:
00203     return _RegistryGetValueUsingWinReg(key, value)
00204   except ImportError:
00205     pass
00206 
00207   # Fallback to reg.exe if we fail to import _winreg.
00208   text = _RegistryQuery(key, value)
00209   if not text:
00210     return None
00211   # Extract value.
00212   match = re.search(r'REG_\w+\s+([^\r]+)\r\n', text)
00213   if not match:
00214     return None
00215   return match.group(1)
00216 
00217 
00218 def _CreateVersion(name, path, sdk_based=False):
00219   """Sets up MSVS project generation.
00220 
00221   Setup is based off the GYP_MSVS_VERSION environment variable or whatever is
00222   autodetected if GYP_MSVS_VERSION is not explicitly specified. If a version is
00223   passed in that doesn't match a value in versions python will throw a error.
00224   """
00225   if path:
00226     path = os.path.normpath(path)
00227   versions = {
00228       '2015': VisualStudioVersion('2015',
00229                                   'Visual Studio 2015',
00230                                   solution_version='12.00',
00231                                   project_version='14.0',
00232                                   flat_sln=False,
00233                                   uses_vcxproj=True,
00234                                   path=path,
00235                                   sdk_based=sdk_based,
00236                                   default_toolset='v140'),
00237       '2013': VisualStudioVersion('2013',
00238                                   'Visual Studio 2013',
00239                                   solution_version='13.00',
00240                                   project_version='12.0',
00241                                   flat_sln=False,
00242                                   uses_vcxproj=True,
00243                                   path=path,
00244                                   sdk_based=sdk_based,
00245                                   default_toolset='v120'),
00246       '2013e': VisualStudioVersion('2013e',
00247                                    'Visual Studio 2013',
00248                                    solution_version='13.00',
00249                                    project_version='12.0',
00250                                    flat_sln=True,
00251                                    uses_vcxproj=True,
00252                                    path=path,
00253                                    sdk_based=sdk_based,
00254                                    default_toolset='v120'),
00255       '2012': VisualStudioVersion('2012',
00256                                   'Visual Studio 2012',
00257                                   solution_version='12.00',
00258                                   project_version='4.0',
00259                                   flat_sln=False,
00260                                   uses_vcxproj=True,
00261                                   path=path,
00262                                   sdk_based=sdk_based,
00263                                   default_toolset='v110'),
00264       '2012e': VisualStudioVersion('2012e',
00265                                    'Visual Studio 2012',
00266                                    solution_version='12.00',
00267                                    project_version='4.0',
00268                                    flat_sln=True,
00269                                    uses_vcxproj=True,
00270                                    path=path,
00271                                    sdk_based=sdk_based,
00272                                    default_toolset='v110'),
00273       '2010': VisualStudioVersion('2010',
00274                                   'Visual Studio 2010',
00275                                   solution_version='11.00',
00276                                   project_version='4.0',
00277                                   flat_sln=False,
00278                                   uses_vcxproj=True,
00279                                   path=path,
00280                                   sdk_based=sdk_based),
00281       '2010e': VisualStudioVersion('2010e',
00282                                    'Visual C++ Express 2010',
00283                                    solution_version='11.00',
00284                                    project_version='4.0',
00285                                    flat_sln=True,
00286                                    uses_vcxproj=True,
00287                                    path=path,
00288                                    sdk_based=sdk_based),
00289       '2008': VisualStudioVersion('2008',
00290                                   'Visual Studio 2008',
00291                                   solution_version='10.00',
00292                                   project_version='9.00',
00293                                   flat_sln=False,
00294                                   uses_vcxproj=False,
00295                                   path=path,
00296                                   sdk_based=sdk_based),
00297       '2008e': VisualStudioVersion('2008e',
00298                                    'Visual Studio 2008',
00299                                    solution_version='10.00',
00300                                    project_version='9.00',
00301                                    flat_sln=True,
00302                                    uses_vcxproj=False,
00303                                    path=path,
00304                                    sdk_based=sdk_based),
00305       '2005': VisualStudioVersion('2005',
00306                                   'Visual Studio 2005',
00307                                   solution_version='9.00',
00308                                   project_version='8.00',
00309                                   flat_sln=False,
00310                                   uses_vcxproj=False,

00320                                    sdk_based=sdk_based),
00321   }
00322   return versions[str(name)]

00325 def _ConvertToCygpath(path):
00326   """Convert to cygwin path if we are using cygwin."""
00327   if sys.platform == 'cygwin':
00328     p = subprocess.Popen(['cygpath', path], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
00329     path = p.communicate()[0].strip()
00330   return path
00331 
00332 
00333 def _DetectVisualStudioVersions(versions_to_check, force_express):
00334   """Collect the list of installed visual studio versions.
00335 
00336   Returns:
00337     A list of visual studio versions installed in descending order of
00338     usage preference.
00339     Base this on the registry and a quick check if devenv.exe exists.
00340     Only versions 8-10 are considered.
00341     Possibilities are:
00342       2005(e) - Visual Studio 2005 (8)
00343       2008(e) - Visual Studio 2008 (9)
00344       2010(e) - Visual Studio 2010 (10)
00345       2012(e) - Visual Studio 2012 (11)
00346       2013(e) - Visual Studio 2013 (12)
00347       2015    - Visual Studio 2015 (14)
00348     Where (e) is e for express editions of MSVS and blank otherwise.
00349   """
00350   version_to_year = {
00351       '8.0': '2005',
00352       '9.0': '2008',
00353       '10.0': '2010',
00354       '11.0': '2012',
00355       '12.0': '2013',
00356       '14.0': '2015',
00357   }
00358   versions = []
00359   for version in versions_to_check:
00360     # Old method of searching for which VS version is installed
00361     # We don't use the 2010-encouraged-way because we also want to get the
00362     # path to the binaries, which it doesn't offer.
00363     keys = [r'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\%s' % version,
00364             r'HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\VisualStudio\%s' % version,
00365             r'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\VCExpress\%s' % version,
00366             r'HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\VCExpress\%s' % version]
00367     for index in range(len(keys)):
00368       path = _RegistryGetValue(keys[index], 'InstallDir')
00369       if not path:
00370         continue
00371       path = _ConvertToCygpath(path)
00372       # Check for full.
00373       full_path = os.path.join(path, 'devenv.exe')
00374       express_path = os.path.join(path, '*express.exe')
00375       if not force_express and os.path.exists(full_path):
00376         # Add this one.
00377         versions.append(_CreateVersion(version_to_year[version],
00378             os.path.join(path, '..', '..')))
00379       # Check for express.
00380       elif glob.glob(express_path):
00381         # Add this one.
00382         versions.append(_CreateVersion(version_to_year[version] + 'e',
00383             os.path.join(path, '..', '..')))
00384 
00385     # The old method above does not work when only SDK is installed.
00386     keys = [r'HKLM\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\SxS\VC7',
00387             r'HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\VisualStudio\SxS\VC7']
00388     for index in range(len(keys)):
00389       path = _RegistryGetValue(keys[index], version)
00390       if not path:
00391         continue
00392       path = _ConvertToCygpath(path)
00393       if version != '14.0':  # There is no Express edition for 2015.
00394         versions.append(_CreateVersion(version_to_year[version] + 'e',
00395             os.path.join(path, '..'), sdk_based=True))
00396 
00397   return versions
00398 
00399 
00400 def SelectVisualStudioVersion(version='auto', allow_fallback=True):
00401   """Select which version of Visual Studio projects to generate.
00402 
00403   Arguments:
00404     version: Hook to allow caller to force a particular version (vs auto).
00405   Returns:
00406     An object representing a visual studio project format version.
00407   """
00408   # In auto mode, check environment variable for override.
00409   if version == 'auto':
00410     version = os.environ.get('GYP_MSVS_VERSION', 'auto')
00411   version_map = {
00412     'auto': ('14.0', '12.0', '10.0', '9.0', '8.0', '11.0'),
00413     '2005': ('8.0',),
00414     '2005e': ('8.0',),
00415     '2008': ('9.0',),
00416     '2008e': ('9.0',),
00417     '2010': ('10.0',),
00418     '2010e': ('10.0',),
00419     '2012': ('11.0',),
00420     '2012e': ('11.0',),
00421     '2013': ('12.0',),
00422     '2013e': ('12.0',),
00423     '2015': ('14.0',),
00424   }
00425   override_path = os.environ.get('GYP_MSVS_OVERRIDE_PATH')
00426   if override_path:
00427     msvs_version = os.environ.get('GYP_MSVS_VERSION')
00428     if not msvs_version:
00429       raise ValueError('GYP_MSVS_OVERRIDE_PATH requires GYP_MSVS_VERSION to be '
00430                        'set to a particular version (e.g. 2010e).')
00431     return _CreateVersion(msvs_version, override_path, sdk_based=True)
00432   version = str(version)
00433   versions = _DetectVisualStudioVersions(version_map[version], 'e' in version)
00434   if not versions:
00435     if not allow_fallback:
00436       raise ValueError('Could not locate Visual Studio installation.')
00437     if version == 'auto':
00438       # Default to 2005 if we couldn't find anything
00439       return _CreateVersion('2005', None)
00440     else:
00441       return _CreateVersion(version, None)
00442   return versions[0]
